title: latest develop causing a goroutine stack overflow
body:
üêû Bug Report ### Description Running beacon-chain is causing a runtime goroutine stack exceeds 1000000000-byte limit This is likely a newly introduced infinite recursion? ### Has this worked before in a previous version? This has only manifested itself recently ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Came across it running interop - rm -rf /tmp/genesis.szz - bazel run //tools/genesis-state-gen -- --num-validators=4000 --output-ssz=/tmp/genesis.ssz --mainnet-config - bazel run //beacon-chain -- --datadir /tmp/chaindata --force-clear-db --interop-genesis-state /tmp/genesis.ssz --interop-eth1data-votes --min-sync-peers=0 --http-web3provider=https://eth-goerli.alchemyapi.io/v2/xxxx --deposit-contract 0x8A04d14125D0FDCDc742F4A05C051De07232EDa4 --pyrmont --bootstrap-node= Error output listed below so not to litter here. ## üî• Error 

runtime: goroutine stack exceeds 1000000000-byte limit
runtime: sp=0xc02527c340 stack=[0xc02527c000, 0xc04527c000]
fatal error: stack overflow
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** Ubuntu 20.04 8 GM RAM **What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** Latest develop branch > git pull origin develop
